channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NC
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NC

item.title: Report X-2024070300
item.description:
Report X-2024070300

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-05T18:14:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-02
  • City: KERNERSVILLE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package was found on the dock with wet outer contents. Upon inspection package was found that one of the four inner containers was completely missing its lid causing internal leakage. Package was placed into hazmat bag, and then into a salvage drum.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER ARRIVED TO PD 8 WEARING PROPER PPE. THE PACKAGE WAS LEAKING ON THE BELT. RESPONDER USED DECISION TREE AND CORROSIVE RESPONSE SHEETS TO CLEAN UP THE SPILL. PACKAGE WAS TRANSPORTED TO DMP AREA FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report I-2024070001
item.description:
Report I-2024070001

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-05T18:14:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-24
  • City: Greensboro
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SOUTHEASTERN FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During the unloading phase of trailer, employee was attempting to unload a pallet of freight with a forklift, the forklift blades were protruding past the pallet and punctured a pail in front of the pallet. Contact was made at the top side of the pail putting a 1.5 inch long puncture in the pail. Pail was then placed in a position to where the material would not leak further. All spillage of material was confined to immediate area for cleanup.

item.title: Report X-2024061819
item.description:
Report X-2024061819

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-01T15:12:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-28
  • City: CONCORD
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package was found in Unload B door number 106. Upon inspection it was found. Package had been sent overhead at another facility 310-BRSL-N at 21:44pm on 6-26-24. package was taken out of trailer by Sort manager and DG-Admin, package contents had been eating away at outer packaging for an unknown amount of time. The right side of the package had been completely eaten away covering the bottles and outer package in a black slug. Box and bottle had become warm to the touch.

item.title: Report X-2024061713
item.description:
Report X-2024061713

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-01T15:12:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-25
  • City: CONCORD
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: 1. X-2024061713 attachment Name:Hazmat- Damaged Haz Mat Package Disposition 04302024.pdf 2. X-2024061729 The package was brought to us from the bulk truck area manager. She found it underneath the rollers and was in a tote. The bottom of the box had a wet spot so it was brought to us to inspect. Upon inspection, we found a small puncture in the bottom of the plastic can. It released some of the liquid in the box so we made sure to secure this in a lined hazmat tote and placed it in the Hazmat cage.
